contents.description: The Property DataSetList of type DataSetDefinition contains the descriptors for all the parameters used to set up the machine.

contents.name: LastChangeDate
contents.description: The Property LastChangeDate is the date and time of the last change applied to the machine module configuration and the effective date of the modification.

contents.name: LongestMicroStopDuration
contents.description: The Property LongestMicroStopDuration is the maximum duration of a micro-stop in seconds, longer stops are not micro-stops. Operators are not required to enter a root cause for micro-stops.

contents.name: RootCauseGroupList
contents.description: The Property RootCauseGroupList is the list of groups that root causes can be grouped in. They are defined by the end user.

contents.name: RootCauseList
contents.description: The Property RootCauseList is the complete list of the root causes that the end user has defined to classify and organize the downtime due to the machine module stops. The RootCauseList is user defined.

contents.name: RootCauseListInputIsMandatory
contents.description: The Property RootCauseListInputIsMandatory is true when the operator is mandatorily required to select the root cause that best describes the current stop situation. For micro- stops such requirement does not apply.

contents.name: StopReasonList
contents.description: The Property StopReasonList is a list containing the descriptors for all the possible machine module messages, including alarms and warnings. Messages include their localization. The list is defined, created and maintained by the OEM.

contents.name: GetDataSetList
contents.description: The GetDatasetList Method returns the list of descriptions for parameters of the dataset filtered by the dependency and subset created by the user.

contents.name: GetRootCauseGroupList
contents.description: The GetRootCauseGroupList Method returns the complete list of root cause groups as persisted by the server.

contents.name: GetRootCauseList
contents.description: The GetRootCauseList Method returns the complete list of root causes as persisted by the server.

contents.name: GetStopReasonList
contents.description: The GetStopReasonList Method returns the complete list of stop reasons as persisted by the server.

contents.name: SetDataSetListMESID
contents.description: The SetDataSetListMESID Method sets the MES_ID of one or more items of the array Definitions contained in the DataSetList. Each item of Definitions is identified by its ID.

contents.name: SetRootCauseLists
contents.description: The SetRootCauseLists Method sets both the RootCauseList and RootCauseGroupList according to the input arguments.

contents.name: State
contents.description: The Property State describes the status of the state machine controlling the machine module. State provides a subset of the information of the state machine, when the latter is implemented.

contents.name: AcknowledgeAlarms
contents.description: The AcknowledgeAlarms Method acknowledges all alarms of the machine module.

contents.name: ResetAggregates
contents.description: The method resets all aggregated values calculated by each ProcessItem

contents.name: SendCommand
contents.description: The Method SendCommand sends a command to change the state of the machine module state machine. The Method SendCommand sends a command to change the state of the machine module state machine.

contents.name: SetControlMode
contents.description: The SetControlMode Method sets the control mode of the machine module.

contents.name: SetIdleEnergySavingMode
contents.description: The Method SetIdleEnergySavingMode activates the energy saving mode when the machine module is idle.

contents.name: Alarms
contents.description: The Alarms folder contains alarms of the machine module.

contents.name: Data
contents.description: The Data Folder contains additional data that is not identified elsewhere in this specification.

contents.name: StateMachine
contents.description: The state machine describes the current state of the machine, the possible transitions and their conditions.

description: The MachineModuleProductionType Object provides information about the current production order and quantity produced as well as affordances to start/stop a production order and reset totals for the machine module.

schemas.description: The ProductionOrderType structure contains the complete production order information.
The ProductionOrderHeaderType structure contains the header information for a production order.
The MaterialDefinitionType structure contains the definition of a material. It is harmonised with ISA 95 Material Definition.
The DataDescriptionType structure contains a metadata, i.e. a description.
The ProductionStatusEnumeration contains the production state of a machine module.
The MethodExecutionFeedbackType provides suitable feedback, both positive and negative, to an OPC UA client invoking a method.
The MessageType provides a uniquely identified localised text.
The MaterialListType structure contains a set of material list items.
The MaterialListItemType structure contains a single material to be processed.
The MaterialStockStatusEnumeration provides the stock status for a material lot.
The MaterialSublotType structure contains the material sublot information. It is harmonised with ISA 95 Material Sublot.
The MaterialLotType structure contains the material lot information. It is harmonised with ISA 95 Material Lot.
The DataSetType structure contains a set of data values.
The DataSetEntryType structure contains the value of a single parameter, or data value.

contents.name: AssignedProductionOrders
contents.description: The AssignedProductionOrders array contains the production orders that have been assigned to the machine module and have not yet been started or unassigned.

contents.name: AutoComplete
contents.description: The AutoComplete boolean defines how to trigger the machine module to complete the execution of a production order.

contents.name: AutoStart
contents.description: The Autostart Boolean defines how to trigger the machine module to start a production order.

contents.name: ProductionOrder
contents.description: The production order header in execution at the machine module.

contents.name: ProductionStatus
contents.description: The execution status of the production order.

contents.name: AbortProductionOrder
contents.description: The AbortProductionOrder method is used to abnormally terminate, or abort, a production order that is in execution or starting or completing. Aborting cannot be reversed or undone.

contents.name: AssignProductionOrder
contents.description: The AssignProductionOrder Method is used to transfer the information of an upcoming production order to the machine module.

contents.name: ClearProductionOrder
contents.description: The ClearProductionOrder method is used to positively confirm that the machine module where a production order is aborted has been cleared of the product or parts left by the aborted production order.

contents.name: CompleteProductionOrder
contents.description: The CompleteProductionOrder method is used to complete a production order in execution.

contents.name: ResetProductionTotals
contents.description: The Method ResetProductionTotals simultaneously resets the totals of the machine components belonging to the following machine folders: DefectDetectionSensors, MaterialLoadingPoints, MaterialOutputPoints, MaterialRejectionPoints.

contents.name: StartProductionOrder
contents.description: The StartProductionOrder Method starts a production order at the machine module.

contents.name: UnassignProductionOrder
contents.description: The UnAssignProductionOrder method is used to remove the specified production order from AssignedProductionOrders[] of an infeed machine module.

contents.name: Data
contents.description: The Data folder provides additional production data that is not identified elsewhere in this specification. e.g. a shift report.

contents.name: StateMachine
contents.description: The StateMachine extends ProductionStatus and provides detailed production execution status as well as methods to trigger the transitions and events when the transitions occur.

description: The MachineModuleSetupType ObjectType contains the value of all the settings (including mechanical adjustments) required to run production as well as affordances to validate and load settings for the machine module.

schemas.description: The DataSetType structure contains a set of data values.
The MaterialListType structure contains a set of material list items.
The MethodExecutionFeedbackType provides suitable feedback, both positive and negative, to an OPC UA client invoking a method.
The DataSetEntryType structure contains the value of a single parameter, or data value.
The MessageType provides a uniquely identified localised text.
The MaterialListItemType structure contains a single material to be processed.
The MaterialStockStatusEnumeration provides the stock status for a material lot.
The MaterialSublotType structure contains the material sublot information. It is harmonised with ISA 95 Material Sublot.
The MaterialLotType structure contains the material lot information. It is harmonised with ISA 95 Material Lot.
The MaterialDefinitionType structure contains the definition of a material. It is harmonised with ISA 95 Material Definition.
The DataDescriptionType structure contains a metadata, i.e. a description.

contents.name: DataSet
contents.description: DataSet contains all the digital settings (other than the mechanical settings stored in the folder MechanicalAdjustments) required by the machine module.

contents.name: MaterialList
contents.description: MaterialList contains the list of materials that are going to be used for the production of the current production order.

contents.name: LoadDataSet
contents.description: The LoadDataSet Method loads the dataset to the underlying system after having validated that (a) the dataset is complete when IsCompleteDataset is True and (b) the dataset is valid.

contents.name: LoadMaterialList
contents.description: The LoadMaterialList Method loads the material list to the underlying system after having validated that (a) the material list is complete and (b) the material list is valid.

contents.name: ValidateDataSet
contents.description: The ValidateDataSet Method transfers a dataset, complete when IsCompleteDataSet is True, to the underlying system and returns the result of the validation, i.e. verifying that the dataset is complete and can run in production.

contents.name: ValidateMaterialList
contents.description: The ValidateMaterialList Method transfers a material list to the underlying system and returns the result of the validation.

contents.name: DataSetFolder
contents.description: The DataSetFolder contains the DataSet including values and descriptions. It contains the same information as DataSet but in a way that is friendlier to simple clients.

contents.name: MechanicalAdjustments
contents.description: The MechanicalAdjustments folder contains the non-digital settings required to setup the machine e.g. mechanical adjustments.

description: The MachineModuleSpecificationType provides the specification of the machine module as currently operating including capabilities, internal buffers and loading points.

schemas.description: The MaterialPointType structure provides the description of the capability of a load or unload point.
The MaterialStorageBufferDataType structure provides the description of the capability of a material storage buffer.
The StorageLogicEnumeration describes standard loading and unloading material configurations.
The MethodExecutionFeedbackType provides suitable feedback, both positive and negative, to an OPC UA client invoking a method.
The MessageType provides a uniquely identified localised text.
The MaterialDefinitionType structure contains the definition of a material. It is harmonised with ISA 95 Material Definition.
The DataDescriptionType structure contains a metadata, i.e. a description.
The StorageMixingLogicEnumeration describes standard ways of mixing material in a material storage buffer.

contents.name: LocationName
contents.description: The Property LocationName of type String contains the location of the machine module within the user production site.

contents.name: MaterialLoadingPoints
contents.description: The Property MaterialLoadingPoints identifies the loading points of the machine module and their capability in terms of what materials can be loaded at a loading point. The Property MaterialLoadingPoints is defined as a list of objects of type MaterialPointType.

contents.name: MaterialOutputPoints
contents.description: The Property MaterialOutputPoints identifies the output points of the machine module and their capability in terms of what materials can be output The Property MaterialOutputPoints is defined as a list of objects of type MaterialPointType.

contents.name: MaterialRejectionPoints
contents.description: The Property MaterialRejectionPoints identifies the rejection points of the machine module and their capability in terms of what materials are rejected The Property MaterialRejectionPoints is defined as a list of objects of type MaterialPointType.

contents.name: MaterialStorageBuffers
contents.description: The Property MaterialStorageBuffers describes the buffers inside the machine module and their current status. The Property MaterialStorageBuffers is a list of objects of type MaterialStorageBufferDataType.

contents.name: TimeZone
contents.description: The local time zone where the machine operates. It is required to convert UTC times into local time.

contents.name: TotalRunningHours
contents.description: The Property TotalRunningHours counts the number of hours the machine module has been in operation since the last time its configuration was changed.

contents.name: UserMachineName
contents.description: The Property UserMachineName of type String contains the name used by the user to identify the machine module. LocationName and UserMachineName uniquely identify the machine module in the user organization.

contents.name: ValidSince
contents.description: The Property ValidSince is the date since the configuration was last modified.

contents.name: DeleteSpecificationRecord
contents.description: The DeleteSpecificationRecord Method deletes a specification record.

contents.name: LoadMachineModuleDocumentation
contents.description: The LoadMachineModuleDocumentation Method allows to securely load any machine module documentation to the documentation repository DocumentationRep folder where it can be reached by applications.

contents.name: RemoveMachineModuleDocumentation
contents.description: The RemoveMachineModuleDocumentation Method allows to securely remove, i.e. permanently delete, any machine module documentation from the documentation repository Documentation.

contents.name: SetNewSpecification
contents.description: The Method SetNewSpecification saves its arguments as the new specification for the machine module. Prior to that it saves the previous specification into the PastSpecification Records Object of the same machine module.

contents.name: Documentation
contents.description: The Object DocumentationRep is the sole repository for the machine module documentation resources. The DocumentationRep is accessed, for example, by clients and HMIs.

description: The MaterialLocationType ObjectType describes locations where material is stored around a machine module. Examples of such locations are the designated areas on the floor where materials are delivered for consumption or where material produced by the machine is waiting to be collected. When the location where the material is stored is integral part of the mechanics or control of the machine, the location shall be modelled as a MaterialStorageBuffer.

schemas.description: The StateEnumeration contains the PackML states for a machine.
The MaterialSublotType structure contains the material sublot information. It is harmonised with ISA 95 Material Sublot.
The MaterialLotType structure contains the material lot information. It is harmonised with ISA 95 Material Lot.
The MaterialDefinitionType structure contains the definition of a material. It is harmonised with ISA 95 Material Definition.
The MaterialStockStatusEnumeration provides the stock status for a material lot.
The DataDescriptionType structure contains a metadata, i.e. a description.

contents.name: CanReceive
contents.description: When True, material sublots or carriers can be stored in the material location. It is set by the underlying system to make the material location available for receiving.

contents.name: CanSend
contents.description: When True, material sublots or carriers can be removed in the material location. It is set by the underlying system to make the material location available for sending.

contents.name: ID
contents.description: The unique identifier for the material location.

contents.name: MES_ID
contents.description: The unique identifier of the material location according to a higher-level system, e.g. MES or ERP.

contents.name: State
contents.description: The state the material location is in.

contents.name: Carriers
contents.description: The Carriers folder provides carriers that are stored in the material location.

contents.name: StateMachine
contents.description: The state machine describing the state and transitions of the material location.

contents.name: UIInfo
contents.description: The visualization resources to display the MaterialLocationType on the User Interface.

description: The ProcessItemType is used to measure and monitor over time a measurement point. The ProcessItemType also provides aggregates (Avg, Max, Min, Std, Total) that are computed by the underlying system.

schemas.description: The MethodExecutionFeedbackType provides suitable feedback, both positive and negative, to an OPC UA client invoking a method.
The MessageType provides a uniquely identified localised text.

contents.name: AggregationWindow
contents.description: Tthe number of samples over which the aggregates are computed. When the number of aggregated samples since the last reset exceeds the AggregationWindow, the aggregates are rolled over, i.e. computed over the last AggregationWindow number of samples.

contents.name: LastResetTime
contents.description: The time (in UTC) when ResetAggregates was last successfully executed.

contents.name: Avg
contents.description: The average of valid values over the last AggregationWindow samples and after the last reset. It is only reset by the successful execution of the ResetAggregates method.

contents.name: Max
contents.description: The maximum valid value for the last AggregationWindow samples and after the last reset. It is only reset by the successful execution of the ResetAggregates method.

contents.name: Min
contents.description: The minimum valid value for the last AggregationWindow samples and after the last reset. It is only reset by the successful execution of the ResetAggregates method.

contents.name: SamplingRate
contents.description: The rate samples are collected for aggregation. The rate is referred to the either product or time, as indicated by the EURange property.

contents.name: Std
contents.description: The standard deviation of the valid value for the last AggregationWindow samples and after the last reset.

contents.name: Total
contents.description: The accumulated total of the valid value for the last AggregationWindow samples and after the last reset. It is only reset by the successful execution of the ResetAggregates method.

contents.name: Value
contents.description: Value represents the current value measured by the sensor.

contents.name: ResetAggregates
contents.description: The Method ResetAggregates restarts from new the computation of aggregates performed by the underlying system.

contents.name: UIInfo
contents.description: The visualization resources to display the ProcessItemType on the User Interface.

description: The ProcessControlItem Object Type describes a generic control loop including the measured variable to be controlled (PV), the desired value for the variable (SP) and the signal to the actuator (CV) to bring the PV to match the SP.

schemas.description: The MethodExecutionFeedbackType provides suitable feedback, both positive and negative, to an OPC UA client invoking a method.
The MessageType provides a uniquely identified localised text.

contents.name: OperatorControl
contents.description: The OperatorControl variable qualifies the source of the ProcessControlItem Value when RemoteControl is False, otherwise OperatorControl is undefined. When OperatorControl is True, the underlying system exposes the information that the ProcessControlItem Value is modified by the operator with respect to the nominal value, e.g. NominalRate, a.k.a. design speed for a speed control loop. When OperatorControl is False, the underlying system exposes the information that the ProcessControlItem Value is not modified by the operator.

contents.name: RemoteControl
contents.description: The RemoteControl variable lets the underlying system expose which system is currently in control of the ProcessControlItem. More specifically, if RemoteControl is True, the underlying system copies the RemoteValue to the ProcesControlItem Value to drive it, i.e. the ProcessControlItem is remotely controlled. If RemoteControl is False, the underlying system is not using RemoteValue to drive the ProcessControlItem, but another value that is exposed as the ProcessControlItem Value, i.e. the ProcessControlItem is locally controlled. A client requests (resp. releases) control of the ProcessControlItem by setting RemoteControl to True (resp. False) preferably by invoking the SetRemoteControl Method. If the client does not support methods, then the client sets RemoteControl to True. The underlying system will reset RemoteControl to False if remote control is not activated.

contents.name: RemoteControlEnable
contents.description: The RemoteControlEnable variable exposes when the underlying system is ready to activate the RemoteControl upon a request by a client. When RemoteControlEnable is False, the underlying system is not ready and will not activate a request to remotely control the ProcessControlItem.

contents.name: RemoteValue
contents.description: The value set by the client to override the object value.

contents.name: SetRemoteControl
contents.description: The SetRemoteControl Method enables or disables the remote control mode.

description: The SensorFunctionType describes a single measuring function or quality sampling function.

schemas.description: The MethodExecutionFeedbackType provides suitable feedback, both positive and negative, to an OPC UA client invoking a method.
The MessageType provides a uniquely identified localised text.

contents.name: DetectionMode
contents.description: When DetectionMode is True, the sensor function measures the sensor value and the inner defect reasons are enabled, meaning they can be active or not.

contents.name: SensorValue
contents.description: The value measured for the sensor function.

contents.name: LoadReferenceFeatures
contents.description: The Method LoadReferenceFeatures loads binary profiles to be used as references for defect detection.

contents.name: SetDetectionMode
contents.description: The method SetDetectionMode enables or disables the detection function and the underneath defect reasons.

contents.name: DefectReason
contents.description: The defect reasons triggered by the sensor function.

contents.name: UIInfo
contents.description: The visualization resources to display the SensorFunctionType on the User Interface.

description: The MachineModuleProductionStateMachineType provides state information about the execution of a production order at a Machine Module.

contents.name: Aborted
contents.description: The product(s) or parts present in the machine module are discharged from the machine, either through machine specific automatic sequences or manually by the operators.

contents.name: AbortedToComplete
contents.description: It represents the transition from Aborted to Complete.

contents.name: Aborting
contents.description: The underlying system performs the preparation to complete the production order which is complete in the active upstream machine modules.

contents.name: AbortingToAborted
contents.description: It represents the transition from Aborting to Aborted.

contents.name: Assigned
contents.description: The information for at least one production order to be started is available.

contents.name: AssignedToComplete
contents.description: It represents the transition from Assigned to Complete.

contents.name: AssignedToStarting
contents.description: It represents the transition from Assigned to Starting.

contents.name: Complete
contents.description: The machine module does not accept any more input product(s) or parts, the ProductionOrder is nulled and the machine is ready to execute a new production order.

contents.name: CompleteToAssigned
contents.description: It represents the transition from Complete to Assigned.

contents.name: Completing
contents.description: The underlying system performs the preparation to complete the production order which is complete in the active upstream machine modules.

contents.name: CompletingToAborting
contents.description: It represents the transition from Completing to Aborting.

contents.name: CompletingToComplete
contents.description: It represents the transition from Completing to Complete.

contents.name: Execute
contents.description: The production order is processed and input product(s) or parts are received.

contents.name: ExecuteToAborting
contents.description: It represents the transition from Execute to Aborting.

contents.name: ExecuteToCompleting
contents.description: It represents the transition from Execute to Completing.

contents.name: Starting
contents.description: The underlying system performs the preparation to process product or parts according to the started production order.

contents.name: StartingToAborting
contents.description: It represents the transition from Starting to Aborting.

contents.name: StartingToExecute
contents.description: It represents the transition from Starting to Execute.

description: The ProductionOrderExecutionStateMachineType provides state information about the execution of a production order at a production line.

schemas.description: The ProductionOrderHeaderType structure contains the header information for a production order.
The MaterialDefinitionType structure contains the definition of a material. It is harmonised with ISA 95 Material Definition.
The DataDescriptionType structure contains a metadata, i.e. a description.

contents.name: ProductionOrderHeader
contents.description: The ProductionOrderHeader of the production order in execution. When no production order is in execution, the ProductionOrderNumber in the ProductionOrderHeader is an empty string.

contents.name: Aborted
contents.description: When a production order is aborted, it is persisted in memory for a period of time defined by ProductionOrderRetentionTime.

contents.name: Aborting
contents.description: When the ProductionOrderExecutionStateMachine is Aborting, the production order is aborted in each active machine module where the production order is present.

contents.name: AbortingToAborted
contents.description: It represents the transition from Aborting to Aborted.

contents.name: Assigned
contents.description: When the ProductionOrderExecutionStateMachine is Assigned, the infeed machine module(s) have been assigned for the execution of the production order.

contents.name: AssignedToStarting
contents.description: It represents the transition from Assigned to Starting.

contents.name: AssignedToUnassigning
contents.description: It represents the transition from Assigned to Unassigning.

contents.name: AssignedToUnreleasing
contents.description: It represents the transition from Assigned to Unreleasing.

contents.name: AssigningToAssigned
contents.description: It represents the transition from Assigning to Assigned.

contents.name: Completing
contents.description: When the ProductionOrderExecutionStateMachine is Completing, the production order is being completed in the active machine modules.

contents.name: CompletingToAborting
contents.description: It represents the transition from Completing to Aborting.

contents.name: CompletingToComplete
contents.description: It represents the transition from Completing to Complete.

contents.name: Execute
contents.description: When the ProductionOrderExecutionStateMachine is in Execute, the production order is being executed in the active machine modules.

contents.name: ExecuteToAborting
contents.description: It represents the transition from Execute to Aborting.

contents.name: ExecuteToCompleting
contents.description: It represents the transition from Execute to Completing.

contents.name: MachineModuleProductionOrders
contents.description: The production orders that have been released to the ProductionOrderExecutionLayer. The MachineModuleProductionOrders folder contains one production order for each required machine module having the ProductionOrderHeader (above).

contents.name: Released
contents.description: When the ProductionOrderExecutionStateMachine is Released, the complete production information for the process cell is available in POOL.

contents.name: ReleasedToAssigning
contents.description: It represents the transition from Released to Assigning.

contents.name: ReleasedToUnreleasing
contents.description: It represents the transition from Released to Unreleasing.

contents.name: Releasing
contents.description: When the ProductionOrderExecutionStateMachine is Releasing, production order information for each machine module of the production line is being received by POOL from an external (higher) level system invoking the method as an OPC UA client.

contents.name: ReleasingToReleased
contents.description: It represents the transition from Releasing to Released.

contents.name: ReleasingToUnreleasing
contents.description: It represents the transition from Releasing to Unreleasing.

contents.name: Starting
contents.description: When the ProductionOrderExecutionStateMachine is Starting and the CurrentState of the ProductionState is Execute for the same production order in at least one machine module of the process cell, the state transitions to Execute.

contents.name: StartingToAborting
contents.description: It represents the transition from Starting to Aborting.

contents.name: StartingToExecute
contents.description: It represents the transition from Starting to Execute.

contents.name: UnassigningToReleased
contents.description: It represents the transition from Unsssigning to Released.

contents.name: Unreleased
contents.description: When the ProductionOrderExecutionStateMachine is unreleased, the production order is not intended for execution any longer and is kept in memory for a limited amount of time as specified by ProductionOrderRetentionTime.

contents.name: UnreleasedToReleased
contents.description: It represents the transition from Unreleased to Released.

contents.name: Unreleasing
contents.description: When the ProductionOrderExecutionStateMachine is Unreleasing, POOL unassigns the production order from each machine modules AssignedProductionOrders[] where present using the machine module UnassignProductionOrder() method.

contents.name: UnreleasingToUnreleased
contents.description: It represents the transition from Unreleasing to Unreleased.

description: The TMCDeviceType ObjectType is used to include UIInfo and specify which DeviceType components are mandatory when used in compliance with TMC.

contents.name: UIInfo
contents.description: The visualization resources to display the Device on the User Interface.

description: The ControlModuleType ObjectType represents a control module according to the ISA 95 Physical Structure.

contents.name: Aggregates
contents.description: Aggregates contains aggregate information for the control module e.g., running hours for a motor.

contents.name: Configuration
contents.description: Configuration provides configuration (i.e. seldom changing) settings, stop reasons and root causes of a control module.

contents.name: LiveStatus
contents.description: LiveStatus Object provides information about the real time status of the control module and affordances to control the control module remotely in real time.

contents.name: Setup
contents.description: Setup provides the value of all the digital settings required to run the control module.

description: The AnalogInputType ObjectType describes an analog input signal.

contents.name: RawValue
contents.description: The raw value of the analog input.

contents.name: Value
contents.description: The engineering unit value of the analog input.

description: The DigitalInputType ObjectType describes a digital input signal.

contents.name: Value
contents.description: The raw value of the digital input.

description: The MotorType ObjectType describes a motor.
The MotorType ObjectType describes a sensor.
The MotorType ObjectType describes a valve.
The DefectDetectionSensorType represents a sensor or sensing system fitted to the machine module that detects product defects or a quality sampling point that can be triggered by an operator.

schemas.description: The MethodExecutionFeedbackType provides suitable feedback, both positive and negative, to an OPC UA client invoking a method.
The MessageType provides a uniquely identified localised text.

contents.name: DetectionMode
contents.description: When DetectionMode is True, the defect detection sensor or system detects defects and the inner sensor functions are enabled, meaning they can be active or not.

contents.name: DetectionCountMasterTotal
contents.description: The total number of times a detection occurred. The total is never reset to zero.

contents.name: DetectionCountTotal
contents.description: The total number of times a detection occurred. The total is reset to zero only when the ResetProductionTotals method in the MachineModuleProductionType is executed successfully.

contents.name: SetDetectionMode
contents.description: The Method SetDetectionMode enables or disables the defect detection sensor.

contents.name: SensorFunction
contents.description: The sensor functions that the defect detection sensor or system is measuring.

contents.name: Data
contents.description: The Data Folder contains additional data that is not identified elsewhere in this specification.

description: The EquipmentModuleType ObjectType represents an equipment module according to the ISA 95 Physical Structure.

contents.name: Configuration
contents.description: The Configuration contains all digital settings, stop reasons and root causes of an equipment module.

contents.name: ControlModules
contents.description: The ControlModules folder provides control modules belonging to the equipment module.

contents.name: LiveStatus
contents.description: The LiveStatus Object contains information about the real time status of the equipment module and provides affordances to control the equipment module remotely in real time.

contents.name: ProcessControlLoops
contents.description: The ProcessControlLoops folder contains process control loops of the equipment module.

contents.name: ProcessItems
contents.description: The ProcessItems folder contains process items of the equipment module.

contents.name: Setup
contents.description: The Setup Object contains the value of all the settings (including mechanical adjustments) required to run production as well as affordances to validate and load settings for the equipment module.

description: The MachineModuleType represents a machine module or workcentre.

contents.name: Remote
contents.description: When Remote is True, all methods exposed by the machine module and contained objects are executed and all variables marked as RW can be written to.

contents.name: Configuration
contents.description: The Configuration Object provides the descriptions (metadata) for settings, stop reasons and root causes of the machine module as well as affordances to make modifications.

contents.name: ControlModules
contents.description: The ControlModules folder provides control modules belonging to the machine module (and not belonging to an equipment module).

contents.name: DefectDetectionSensors
contents.description: The DefectDetectionSensors folder provides the sensor(s) and sensing systems fitted to the machine module that detect product defects.

contents.name: EquipmentModules
contents.description: The EquipmentModules folder provides equipment modules of the machine module.

contents.name: LiveStatus
contents.description: The LIveStatus Object provides information about the real time status of the machine module and provides affordances to control the machine module remotely in real time.

contents.name: MaterialBuffers
contents.description: The MaterialBuffers folder provides material storage buffers of the machine module.

contents.name: MaterialLoadingPoints
contents.description: The MaterialLoadingPoints folder provides the loading points and the materials being loaded, as well as the brand integrity checks required.

contents.name: MaterialLocations
contents.description: The MaterialLocations folder provides material locations used to deliver or retrieve materials to/from the machine.

contents.name: MaterialOutputPoints
contents.description: The MaterialOutputPoints folder provides the output(s) of the machine module.

contents.name: MaterialRejectionPoints
contents.description: The MaterialRejectionPoints folder provides rejection traps where material is discarded from the machine module.

contents.name: PastSpecificationRecords
contents.description: The PastSpecificationRecords folder contains the information about the machine as was operating in a previous period of time.

contents.name: ProcessControlLoops
contents.description: The ProcessControlLoops folder provides control loops of the machine module.

contents.name: ProcessItems
contents.description: The ProcessItems folder provides analog sensor values.

contents.name: Production
contents.description: The Production Object provides information about the current production order and quantity produced as well as affordances to start/stop a production order and reset totals for the machine module.

contents.name: Setup
contents.description: The Setup Object contains the value of all the settings (including mechanical adjustments) required to run production as well as affordances to validate and load settings for the machine module.

contents.name: Specification
contents.description: The Specification Object contains the specification about the machine as currently operating including capabilities, internal buffers and loading points.

description: The MaterialLoadingPointType ObjectType describes the machine module part where materials are loaded (either manually or by means of an automated system or both) and the materials being loaded, as well as the brand integrity checks required.

schemas.description: The MaterialSublotType structure contains the material sublot information. It is harmonised with ISA 95 Material Sublot.
The MaterialIntegrityAgentEnumeration identifies the possible agents responsible for material integrity checking.
The MaterialPointType structure provides the description of the capability of a load or unload point.
The MaterialDefinitionType structure contains the definition of a material. It is harmonised with ISA 95 Material Definition.
The DataDescriptionType structure contains a metadata, i.e. a description.
The MaterialValidationStatusEnumeration describes the status of the material validation process.
The MethodExecutionFeedbackType provides suitable feedback, both positive and negative, to an OPC UA client invoking a method.
The MessageType provides a uniquely identified localised text.
The MaterialLotType structure contains the material lot information. It is harmonised with ISA 95 Material Lot.
The MaterialStockStatusEnumeration provides the stock status for a material lot.

contents.name: AllowMixedLots
contents.description: When AllowMixedLots is False and BatchManaged in the material definition of the ExpectedMaterials is True, then one material lot will be processed i.e. the first material lot received.

contents.name: ExpectedMaterials
contents.description: The array of sublots of the material that are expected at the machine loading point for the current production.

contents.name: MaterialIntegrityAgent
contents.description: MaterialIntegrityAgent defines how material validation is performed.

contents.name: MaterialPointDefinition
contents.description: The Property MaterialPointDefinition contains the identification of the material point and the material that is processed.

contents.name: MES_ID
contents.description: Unique identifier for the material point in an external system, e.g. MES.

contents.name: UpstreamHold
contents.description: UpstreamHold is true when the loading point cannot receive more product and the upstream machine is required to stop loading, False when the loading point can receive product.

contents.name: ActualDispensingRate
contents.description: The actual rate at which the input material is being dispensed.

contents.description: The total quantity of material dispensed at the machine after loading at the loading point. This total is never reset.

fields.name: DispensedMaterialMasterTotal
fields.description: The total quantity of material dispensed at the machine after loading at the loading point. This total is never reset.

fields.name: ValueInBUoM

contents.name: DispensedMaterialTotal
contents.description: The total quantity of material dispensed at the machine after loading at the loading point. The quantity is reset by the successful execution of the ResetMachineTotals method, only.

fields.description: The total quantity of material dispensed at the machine after loading at the loading point. The quantity is reset by the successful execution of the ResetMachineTotals method, only.

contents.name: DispensingRateState
contents.description: The DispensingRateState provides information about the state of the dispensing rate justifying why the ActualDispensingRate is different from the NominalDispensingRate.

contents.name: LoadedMaterial
contents.description: An array of the sublots that entered the machine loading point. When a sublot is unloaded, it is also removed from the array.

contents.name: NominalDispensingRate
contents.description: The nominal rate at which the input material is dispensed when the machine runs at design speed.

fields.description: The nominal rate at which the input material is dispensed when the machine runs at design speed.

fields.name: ValueInBUoM

contents.name: PresentedMaterial
contents.description: The material presented to the material loading point, but not yet loaded.

contents.name: PresentedMaterialValidationStatus
contents.description: The status of the validation of the presented material.

contents.name: SetPresentedMaterialValidationStatus
contents.description: The SetPresentedMaterialValidationStatus Method provides a client with an affordance to perform the validation of the PresentedMaterial against the ExpectedMaterials and set the result of the validation in the PresentedMaterialValidationStatus variable.

description: This OPC UA MaterialOutputPointType ObjectType describes the capability and real time information about the hand-over point of material from one machine module to another.

schemas.description: The MaterialDefinitionType structure contains the definition of a material. It is harmonised with ISA 95 Material Definition.
The MaterialPointType structure provides the description of the capability of a load or unload point.
The MaterialSublotType structure contains the material sublot information. It is harmonised with ISA 95 Material Sublot.
The MaterialLotType structure contains the material lot information. It is harmonised with ISA 95 Material Lot.
The MaterialStockStatusEnumeration provides the stock status for a material lot.
The DataDescriptionType structure contains a metadata, i.e. a description.

contents.name: DownstreamHeld
contents.description: When the downstream machine module cannot receive the product flow, the upstream machine is required to hold the transfer of product to the downstream machine module.

contents.name: MaterialDefinition
contents.description: The Property MaterialPointDefinition contains the identification of the material point and the material that is processed.

contents.name: MaterialPointDefinition
contents.description: The identification of the material output physical location and the material capabilities.

contents.name: MES_ID
contents.description: Unique identifier for the material point in an external system, e.g. MES.

contents.name: ActualProductionRate
contents.description: The actual rate at which the output is being produced.

fields.name: ValueInBUoM

contents.description: The nominal rate at which the output is produced, a.k.a. the machine design speed.

fields.name: ValueInBUoM
fields.description: The material quantity in base unit of measure.

contents.name: ProducedMaterial
contents.description: The sublot currently being produced by the material output. The sublot quantity is updated by the underlying system as output is generated.

contents.name: ProducedMaterialMasterTotal
contents.description: The total quantity of complete sublots created at the machine material output. The value is never reset.

contents.name: ProductionRateState
contents.description: The ProductionRateState provides information about the state of the production rate justifying why the ActualProductionRate is different from the NominalProductionRate.

description: The MaterialRejectionPointType describes a device that is capable of rejecting product from the product flow.

schemas.description: The MaterialDefinitionType structure contains the definition of a material. It is harmonised with ISA 95 Material Definition.
The MaterialPointType structure provides the description of the capability of a load or unload point.
The MethodExecutionFeedbackType provides suitable feedback, both positive and negative, to an OPC UA client invoking a method.
The MessageType provides a uniquely identified localised text.
The DataDescriptionType structure contains a metadata, i.e. a description.

contents.name: MaterialDefinition
contents.description: The material definition for the material to be rejected at the rejection trap

contents.name: MaterialPointDefinition
contents.description: The Property MaterialPointDefinition contains the identification of the material point and the material that is processed.

contents.name: MES_ID
contents.description: Unique identifier for the material point in an external system, e.g. MES.

contents.name: RejectionMode
contents.description: When RejectionMode is True, the rejection trap discharges material when triggered, otherwise no material is rejected.

contents.name: RejectedMaterialMasterTotal
contents.description: The total material quantity rejected at the rejection trap. The total is never reset to zero.

fields.name: RejectedMaterialMasterTotal
fields.description: The total material quantity rejected at the rejection trap. The total is never reset to zero.

fields.name: ValueInBUoM
fields.description: The material quantity in base unit of measure.

contents.name: RejectedMaterialRatio
contents.description: The Variable MaterialRejectedRatio is the ratio of the total material rejected (MaterialRejectedTotal) over the total good product and is computed by the underlying system.

contents.name: RejectedMaterialTotal
contents.description: The total material quantity rejected at the rejection trap. The total is reset to zero only when the ResetRejecitonTotals is invoked.

fields.name: RejectedMaterialTotal
fields.description: The total material quantity rejected at the rejection trap. The total is reset to zero only when the ResetRejecitonTotals is invoked.

fields.name: ValueInBUoM
fields.description: The material quantity in base unit of measure.

contents.name: RejectionCountMasterTotal
contents.description: The total number of times the rejection trap was triggered. The total is never reset to zero.

contents.name: RejectionCountTotal
contents.description: The total number of times the rejection trap was triggered. The total is reset to zero only when the ResetRejectionTotals is invoked.

contents.name: RejectionsRatio
contents.description: The Variable RejectionsRatio is the ratio between the good product output total and the rejected quantity total.

contents.name: SetRejectionMode
contents.description: The Method SetRejectionMode turns the rejection on or off. The Method SetRejectionMode turns the rejection on or off.

description: The MaterialStorageBufferType ObjectType describes locations where the product is stored in a machine module and the stored product.

schemas.description: The MaterialStorageBufferDataType structure provides the description of the capability of a material storage buffer.
The StorageMixingLogicEnumeration describes standard ways of mixing material in a material storage buffer.
The StorageLogicEnumeration describes standard loading and unloading material configurations.
The MaterialDefinitionType structure contains the definition of a material. It is harmonised with ISA 95 Material Definition.
The DataDescriptionType structure contains a metadata, i.e. a description.

contents.name: MaterialPointDefinition
contents.description: The Property MaterialPointDefinition contains the identification of the material point and the material that is processed or stored in the buffer.

contents.name: MES_ID
contents.description: Unique identifier for the material point in an external system, e.g. MES.

contents.name: MixingLogic
contents.description: MixingLogic identifies if and how materials can be mixed in the MaterialStorageBuffer.

contents.name: StorageLogic
contents.description: The logic used at the buffer storage to store and retrieve material.

contents.name: TotalStorageCapacity
contents.description: The total capacity of the material storage buffer.

contents.name: ActualLoadingRate
contents.description: The rate at which the material is loaded onto the material storage buffer. The variable LoadingRate indicates the quantity of the material consumed in 60 seconds.

fields.name: ActualLoadingRate
fields.description: The rate at which the material is loaded onto the material storage buffer. The variable LoadingRate indicates the quantity of the material consumed in 60 seconds.

fields.name: ValueInBUoM
fields.description: The material quantity in base unit of measure.

contents.name: ActualUnloadingRate
contents.description: The rate at which the material is unloaded from the material storage buffer. The variable UnloadingRate indicates the quantity of the material consumed in 60 seconds.

fields.name: ActualUnloadingRate
fields.description: The rate at which the material is unloaded from the material storage buffer. The variable UnloadingRate indicates the quantity of the material consumed in 60 seconds.

fields.name: ValueInBUoM
fields.description: The material quantity in base unit of measure.

contents.name: LoadingRateState
contents.description: The LoadingRateState provides information about the state of the loading rate justifying why the ActualLoadingRate is different from the NominalLoadingRate.

fields.name: ValueInBUoM
fields.description: The material quantity in base unit of measure.

fields.name: ValueInBUoM
fields.description: The material quantity in base unit of measure.

contents.name: StoredLot
contents.description: The material stored in the material storage buffer.

fields.name: StoredLot
fields.description: The material stored in the material storage buffer.

fields.name: ValueInBUoM
fields.description: The material quantity in base unit of measure.

contents.name: UnloadingRateState
contents.description: The UnloadingRateState provides information about the state of the unloading rate justifying why the ActualUnloadingRate is different from the NominalUnloadingRate.

description: The ProcessControlLoopType is the general description of a control loop consisting of the desired value (SetPoint) for a measured value (ProcessValue) which is obtained by acting on an actuator (ControlValue).

contents.name: WatchdogEnabled
contents.description: When WatchdogEnable is True, if a ProcessControlLoop components RemoteControl is True and the time between two consecutive writes of the RemoteAnalogMeasurement is longer than WatchdogTimeout, then the underlying system will generate an alarm, set RemoteControl to False and take control of the loop. When WatchdogEnable is False, no watchdog alarm is generated.

contents.name: WatchdogTimeout
contents.description: The longest time between two write actions before a watchdog alarm is generated by the underlying system. The value is expressed in milliseconds.

contents.name: ControlValue
contents.description: The control value is the output of the control loop function. The control value directly drives the actuator.

contents.name: ExternalAlarms
contents.description: The external alarms folder is used to organize external alarms.

contents.name: ProcessValue
contents.description: The value read by a sensor or other analog measurement of the physical quantity that is monitored.

contents.name: SetPoint
contents.description: The value we aim to obtain from the ProcessValue by means of driving the control value.

description: The ProductionOrderOrchestrationLayerType (POOL) ObjectType consists of a set of variables, generated events and methods that are used to orchestrate production orders for a set of Machine Modules that implement the MachineModuleProductionType and are variously connected in a production line.

schemas.description: The ProductionOrderHeaderType structure contains the header information for a production order.
The MethodExecutionFeedbackType provides suitable feedback, both positive and negative, to an OPC UA client invoking a method.
The MessageType provides a uniquely identified localised text.
The DataSetType structure contains a set of data values.
The DataSetEntryType structure contains the value of a single parameter, or data value.
The MaterialListType structure contains a set of material list items.
The MaterialListItemType structure contains a single material to be processed.
The MaterialStockStatusEnumeration provides the stock status for a material lot.
The MaterialSublotType structure contains the material sublot information. It is harmonised with ISA 95 Material Sublot.
The MaterialLotType structure contains the material lot information. It is harmonised with ISA 95 Material Lot.
The DataDescriptionType structure contains a metadata, i.e. a description.
The ProductionOrderType structure contains the complete production order information.
The OrchestrationProductionOrderType structure contains the complete production order information used by the Production Order Orchestration Layer.
The MaterialDefinitionType structure contains the definition of a material. It is harmonised with ISA 95 Material Definition.

contents.name: ProductionOrdersRetentionTime
contents.description: The time in hours a ProductionOrderStateMachine is retained in memory after the production order is complete.

contents.name: AbortProductionOrder
contents.description: The AbortProductionOrder Method is used to abort a production order that is in execution or starting or completing in the production line.

contents.name: AssignProductionOrder
contents.description: The AssignProductionOrder Method is used to assign a production order to one infeed machine module where it shall be executed.

contents.name: CompleteProductionOrder
contents.description: The CompleteProductionOrder Method is used to complete a production order in execution.

contents.name: GetDataSet
contents.description: The GetDataset Method is used to retrieve the data set from a production order header.

contents.name: GetMaterialList
contents.description: The GetMaterialList Method is used to retrieve the material list information from a production order header.

contents.name: GetProductionOrder
contents.description: The GetProductionOrder Method is used to retrieve the complete production order information starting with a production order header as an input argument.

contents.name: ReleaseProductionOrder
contents.description: The ReleaseProductionOrder Method is used to make a production order available to a machine module for orchestrated execution in a production line (Process Cell according to ANSI/ISA-88.00.01-2010 Physical Model).

contents.name: StartProductionOrder
contents.description: The StartProductionOrder Method is used to start the execution of a production order at a machine module specifying the loading points that input materials will be fed to and the output points where output will be directed.

contents.name: UnassignProductionOrder
contents.description: The UnAssignProductionOrder Method is used to unassign a production order previously assigned to an infeed machine module.

contents.name: UnreleaseProductionOrder
contents.description: The UnreleaseProductionOrder Method is used to reverse the effect of the ReleaseProductionOrder method and make a previously released production order unavailable for assignment and production.

contents.name: ProductionOrders
contents.description: ProductionOrders is a folder that organizes objects of type ProductionOrderExecutionStateMachineType i.e., one state machine per production order managed by POOL.

description: The UIInformationType provides graphical specifications required for creating faceplates to display the information made available by the OPC UA Server.

schemas.description: The MethodExecutionFeedbackType provides suitable feedback, both positive and negative, to an OPC UA client invoking a method.
The MessageType provides a uniquely identified localised text.

contents.name: PositionX
contents.description: PositionX is the relative horizontal position of the top-left corner of the object rendering in the target visualization scope.

contents.name: PositionY
contents.description: PositionX is the relative vertical position of the top-left corner of the object rendering in the target visualization scope.

contents.name: PositionZ
contents.description: PositionZ is the depth of the object rendering in the target visualization scope.

contents.name: Resizable
contents.description: When Resizable is True, the UI resource Width is rescaled based on the actual display size.

contents.name: Width
contents.description: Width is the width of the object visualization in the target visualization scope.

contents.name: DeleteUIResource
contents.description: The Method DeleteUIResource permanently removes a UI resource from the underlying system memory.

contents.name: LoadUIResource
contents.description: The Method LoadUIResource loads a UI resource in the underlying system for visualization. It will override the existing UI resource by the same name.

contents.name: UIResources
contents.description: The UIResources folder contains any number of vectorial images of the object to be rendered in the status/mode defined by the name of the file, e.g. Running.svg is the representation of the object when the status is running.

description: The UserInterfaceType provides a generic User Interface description.

contents.name: ControlPanelVURO
contents.description: The control panel area where read-only objects are shown. Objects connected to a ControlPanelVURO by means of a non-hierarchical reference of type IsDisplayedBy are shown in the control panel.

contents.name: ControlPanelVURW
contents.description: The control panel area where read-write objects are shown. Objects connected to a ControlPanelVURW by means of a non-hierarchical reference of type IsDisplayedBy are shown in the control panel.

contents.name: KPIVU
contents.description: The object collecting variables to be displayed in the KPI section. Objects connected to a KPIVU by means of a non-hierarchical reference of type IsDisplayedBy are shown in the KPI display area.

contents.name: LoopVUReferences
contents.description: The collection of references to control loops to be displayed. Non-hierarchical references connected to LoopVuReferences by means of a non-hierarchical reference of type IsDisplayedBy are shown in the control panel.

contents.name: OverVU
contents.description: The overview of the UI interface. Objects connected to an OverVU by means of a non-hierarchical reference of type IsDisplayedBy are shown in the overview display.

contents.name: ZoomedVU
contents.description: The zooned view of the UI interface. Objects connected to a ZoomedVU by means of a non-hierarchical reference of type IsDisplayedBy are shown in the zoomed in area.
